name: nytimes
text: A New York City police union’s Twitter account was suspended on Monday after the union posted a police report on the arrest of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s daughter that contained her personal details, including her address https://t.co/Jl3edt9LG4

name: nytimes
text: RT @carlzimmer: Here are some things we at @NYTScience have been learning about #covid19 over the past six months. (I wrote the entry on mutations.) https://t.co/jA0dnbTxDV https://t.co/aGoLbRP0Iy

name: nytimes
text: William Barr has long held an expansive view of presidential power. With multiple crises converging in the run-up to the 2020 election, he is busy putting his theories to work, @Schwartzesque reports for @NYTmag https://t.co/HtAo0waMKZ

name: nytimes
text: Louisville's mayor fired the city’s police chief after learning that officers' body cameras were not activated when David McAtee, the owner of a local restaurant, was killed after police and National Guard troops shot toward protesters early Monday morning https://t.co/F9xYNNxlGZ https://t.co/5p0nUFmn5q

name: nytimes
text:
Protesters in New York have stopped traffic in both directions on Manhattan's FDR Drive. Some cars trapped on the road are honking in unison with the crowd, which is cheering: “Say his name!”

Follow the latest from our reporters on the ground. https://t.co/XBcGN227gm https://t.co/R3iGVPK9Sx

name: nytimes
text: RT @migold: UPDATE: NYC will have a curfew tomorrow night, starting at 8 pm. That's 3 hours earlier than tonight's. https://t.co/bjFKjg5lQD

name: nytimes
text: After weeks of virtual events, Joe Biden on Monday met with community leaders at Bethel African Methodist Episcopal Church, a black church in Delaware, as the U.S. entered another day of unrest in response to the killing of George Floyd https://t.co/1VteamltCa

name: nytimes
text: This was the scene outside of the White House on Monday as police used tear gas and flash grenades to clear out peaceful protesters so President Trump could visit the nearby St. John’s Church, where there was a parish house basement fire Sunday night https://t.co/nFrCqYpqZR https://t.co/DVP11iiVIh

name: nytimes
text:
Protestors marched across the Brooklyn Bridge on Monday night as New York City entered a 5th night of protests with an 11 p.m. curfew looming.

Read the latest. https://t.co/wVOUwkEexv https://t.co/EvTf3QocMp

name: nytimes
text:
Protesters marched across the Brooklyn Bridge on Monday night as New York City entered a 5th night of protests with an 11 p.m. curfew looming.

name: nytimes
text:
RT @AsteadWesley: “There’s an economic reliance on the system of policing,” one mayor admits. “You have city police, county police, state police, federal police, secret police, secret police that watch the secret police."

"We rely on the over-incarceration of our society" 
https://t.co/K8BE6dUvQc
